hadiths.english_translation: Samurah accompanied the Prophet ﷺ and fought with him, and he had a tie (of kinship/alliance) with the Ansar. His mother was with Murrah ibn Sinan, uncle of Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, so they believe that Samurah was among those who witnessed the battle of Uhud. Then he went down to Basra afterwards and took a plot of land there. Then he came to Kufa and bought houses in Bani Asad at al-Kanasa, built them, lived in them, and died there. He narrated many hadiths from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. Ziyad used to appoint him as governor of Basra when Ziyad went to Kufa.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Harmlah (the grandfather): I came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and prayed the dawn prayer with him. When we finished the prayer, I looked at the faces of the people; I could hardly distinguish their faces after I finished the prayer. When I came near to depart, I said: O Messenger of Allah, advise me. He said: 'Be mindful of Allah in all your affairs. And when you leave a people and hear them saying about you something that pleases you, follow it. And when you hear them saying about you something that you dislike, avoid it.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abd al-Majid ibn Abi Yazid: During the time of Yazid ibn al-Muhallab, I and Hajr ibn Abi Nasr set out for Mecca. We passed by a water called al-Rukhakh, and they told us: There is here a man who has seen the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. So we came to an old man and asked him: Did you see the Messenger of Allah ﷺ? He said: Yes, and he wrote for me about this water. He brought out a skin upon which was written the letter of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. We asked: What is your name? He said: al-Adda' ibn Khalid. We asked: What did you hear from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ? He said: I was under his she-camel on the day of Arafat while she was chewing her cud. He said: 'O people, what day is this? What month is this? What land is this?' We said: Allah and His Messenger know best. He said: 'Is this not a sacred month, a sacred land, and a sacred day?' We said: Allah and His Messenger know best. He said: 'Indeed, your blood, your wealth, and your honor are sacred to you, just as the sacredness of this day of yours, in this month of yours, in this land of yours, until the Day you meet your Lord. O Allah, have I conveyed (the message)? O Allah, be witness.'
